alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 4:14PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN UNION AND NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM MDT... At 413 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Farley, or 25 miles southwest of Des Moines, moving north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raton, Des Moines, Folsom, Sugarite, Capulin and Sugarite Canyon State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 451 and 454. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 350 and 386. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Frequent dangerous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County
